revised_title: The Effects of Radiomimetic Substances on DNA Synthesis and Function in Bacteriophages
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of radiomimetic substances, specifically di(2-chloroethyl)methylamine, on deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) synthesis and function in bacteriophages. They find that the inactivation of phage T2 occurs due to a failure of DNA injection into host cells, which can be caused by internal cross-linking of DNA by the chloro-ethylamine. This study provides insights into the mechanisms of inactivation and potential applications for further research on alkylating agents and host-virus complexes.
